modName: Modular Shader Library for ENBSeries - Skyrim
summary: This is both a library containing multiple shader effects to be used with ENBSeries, as well as an example on how to easily inject various effects with minor amount of coding skills into any .fx or .txt file.
descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#ff7700][size=6][/size][/color][b][color=#cc4125][size=6]INTRODUCTION[/size][/color][/b]
While chatting with some folks at the STEP forum in the enbseries.ini guide, we, myself, Aiyen, Matso and TechAngel, agreed that it would be helpful to newcomers to the ENBSeries "world" to supply them with easy and highly configurable shader files. And that it had a clean look with good amount of info in them, letting the "reader" of the code see what each code line actually do to achieve that particular visual effect.

So I started whipping up my own shader library, borrowing the base template, sort of anyway, from Aiyen's Skylight ENB.
This is however not an extension of Aiyen's Skylight ENB preset, rather something totally different. A base code library for anyone to configure and expand how they see fit.


[size=5][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/fallout4/mods/4088/?][color=#00ff00]Fallout 4 Modular Shader Library[/color]
[size=5][b][/b][/size][/url][size=5][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/7732/?][color=#a4c2f4]Skyrim SE Modular Shader Library[/color][/url][/b][/size]

[/b][/size][b][size=5][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/46871/?][color=#6d9eeb]SVI Series ENB Resource[/color][/url][/size][/b]
Matso's own shader library. Contains much content that I do not cover in my shader library.


[b][color=#cc4125][size=6]FEATURES[/size][/color][/b]
[color=#c9daf8][size=3]Highly customizable and easy customization and addition of various effects for the purpose of altering the visuals.
All ENBSeries default shader effects in easy accessible and injectable .fxh files
Entirely new effects, compared to what is available in the default ENBSeries shader files[/size][/color][/center]



[b][color=#cc4125][size=6]LIST OF EFFECTS[/size][/color][/b]

[spoiler][color=#c9daf8]
[color=#dd7e6b]OVERALL[/color]
- Multiple time of day interpolators. Splits a command into several time and location based commands.
- Luma coefficient/"gray value" equations. For use in color perception effects.
- Color Space conversion codes, XYZ, Yxy, HSL, HSV
- Noise generators. To make filmic grain filters or use them as dither patterns.
- Development tools. Split screen, Visualize Depth, Visualize color clipping.

[color=#dd7e6b]ENBADAPTATION.FX[/color]
- Increased adaptation sensitivity.
- Adjustable Grey Value in game.
- Adjustable Sensitivity, Time, Min and Max commands, which can utilize TOD factor. Split a command into several and all that.

[color=#dd7e6b]ENBBLOOM.FX[/color]
- Limit bloom based on depth.
- Light spread and glow adjustments.
- Tonemapping/"Max White" adjustability.

[color=#dd7e6b]ENBDEPTHOFFIELD.FX[/color]
- Sensitivity adjustemnt.
- Apperture size adjustment.
- Sensor size adjustment.
- Bokeh softness adjustment.
- Blur range adjustment.

[color=#dd7e6b]ENBEFFECT.FX[/color]
- 7 common tone-mapping methods easily accessible from the GUI window.
- Limit adaptation based on depth.
- Auto adjusting color correction by nexstac.
- Reinhard tonemapping.
- Filmic ALU tonemapping.
- Filmic Uncharted 2D tonemapping.
- Improved Tonemapping by Brodiggan Gale.
- Local contrast.
- Local saturation.
- Normalize Saturation.
- Vibrance.
- Color Filter.
- AGCC/Game color correction.
- Simplified AGCC.
- ENB color correction.
- Night Eye adjustments.
- Sepia.
- 3D LUT.
- Palette map.
- Procedural Color Correction.
- ENB Post-process v1,v2,v3,v4.

[color=#dd7e6b]ENBEFFECTPOSTPASS.FX[/color]
- Blur and Sharpen.
- Vignette.
- Grain.
- Letterbox.

[color=#dd7e6b]ENBLENS.FX[/color]
- ENB lens, adjust Color Filter and Contrast
- Oldrim lens, adjust Reflections and Dirt Intensity and Power
[/color][/spoiler]

[b][color=#cc4125][size=6]HOW TO INJECT EFFECTS[/size][/color][/b]

*VIDEO TUTORIAL WILL COME*


[spoiler]
[size=3][color=#dbb0a7]First you need to include the files into the enbeffect.fx, you do that with this code line;
[i]NOTE: msHelpers.fxh and AGCC.fxh will be used for this example.[/i][/color][/size]
[color=#d5a6bd]    #include "/Modular Shaders/msHelpers.fxh"  // This code line needs to be added after the register section inside enbeffect.fx
    #include "/Modular Shaders/enbeffect/70_AGCC.fxh"
[/color]
[size=3][color=#dbb0a7]There, you have now successfully added/included the helper function library and the APPLYGAMECOLORCORRECTION effect library into your file.

Now you need to include it into the rendering stage so it will have an effect on the render output.
For that you need to add this code line for the AGCC code to take affect;[/color][/size][color=#d5a6bd]
    color = msAGCC(color, IN.txcoord0.xy);  // This code line goes into the Pixel shader (PS_D6EC7DD1) after all initialization code is done[/color]

[color=#dbb0a7][size=3]This is how it should look, after you added the above code row;
[/size][/color][color=#d5a6bd]float4 PS_D6EC7DD1(VS_OUTPUT_POST IN, float2 vPos : VPOS) : COLOR {
float4 color = tex2D(_s0, IN.txcoord0.xy); // ENBSeries color output
float4 vbloom = tex2D(_s1, IN.txcoord0.xy); // Vanilla bloom
float4 vadapt = tex2D(_s2, IN.txcoord0.xy); // Vanilla adaptation
float4 ebloom = tex2D(_s3, IN.txcoord0.xy); // ENBSeries bloom
float4 eadapt = tex2D(_s4, IN.txcoord0.xy); // ENBSeries adaptation, xyz = average screen color, w = curved max screen color

// Main ENBSeries Post-Processing computations and injections
    color = msAGCC(color, IN.txcoord0.xy);  // AGCC injection code line

/// OUTPUT
color.w = 1.0;
}[/color]

[color=#dbb0a7][size=3]Now you should see that the AGCC effect is active and in use after you have saved the enbeffect.fx file changes and in game you have pressed the <<<<<APPLY CHANGES>>>>> button found at the of the GUI window.

To make it so you can easily enable or disable the AGCC effect, alter the code so it looks like the below code segment;[/size][/color]
[color=#d5a6bd]// Add the below GUI annotation at the top of the file
    bool ENABLE_AGCC < string UIName="Enable AGCC";  string UIWidget="Spinner";  int UIMin=0; > = {true};
----
// Add the below code into the Pixel Shader (PS_Draw)
    color = lerp(color, msAGCC(color, IN.txcoord0.xy), ENABLE_AGCC);[/color]
[/spoiler]
author: --JawZ-- and Matso

files.name: ENBSeries Shader Library
files.changelogHtml:
Changes from v2 to v3

- New folder structure for an easier experience on where files can be injected
- enbbloom.fx and effect.txt added, with their own shader library
- Altered .fxh effects, too many small changes to remember them all.

files.name: Modular Shader Library Skyrim Rev8
files.changelogHtml:
Changes from Rev7 to Rev8

Additions;
-Implemented Matso's SVI Lens effects
-Implemented new base for Local Operators
-Control Skyrim bloom in Night Eye AGCC
-Added another Saturation method that doesn't alter luminance, doesn't polarize or create other weird things.


Fixes;


Alterations;
-Altered the Local Operator base
-Made several edits I've included in MSL-FO4
-Made it so that the default AGCC code isn't active while Night Eye is active, needs a bit more work though to make it viable with any number of effect combinations
-Made it so that enbPalette.fxh, ms3DLUT.fxh, enbPCC and msPCC.fxh controls to only show up when those options are activated in enbseries.ini
